snippet: The country’s recently created telecommunications regulator issued tough new conditions that could break up virtual monopolies in phone service and television broadcasting.
abstract: Mexico's new regulator makes ruling intended to break virtual monopolies in Mexican telecommunications and television broadcasting; ruling promises to redraw landscape of both industries as it takes direct aim at core businesses of Carlos Slim Helu, whose control over telephony here has made him one of world’s richest men, and Emilio Azcarraga, whose television channels play outsize role in country’s politics.
lead_paragraph: The country’s recently created telecommunications regulator issued tough new conditions that could break up virtual monopolies in phone service and television broadcasting.

headline.main: New Rules to Reshape Telecom in Mexico
headline.print_headline: New Rules to Reshape Telecom in Mexico
